description: On Friday, the Okaloosa County, Fla., Sheriff’s Department said that Deputy Eddie Duran was fired following the completion of an administrative internal affairs investigation amid Fortson’s death.
title: The Florida deputy who shot U.S. airman Roger Fortson has been fired

description: Robinson was a widow and lifelong Chicago resident when she moved to the White House in 2009 to help care for granddaughters Malia and Sasha.
title: Marian Robinson, mother of Michelle Obama, dies at 86

description: Salem Media distributed “2,000 Mules,” which claimed Democrats conspired to steal the 2020 election. Now the company has apologized and will halt any future distribution of the film.
title: Publisher of ‘2,000 Mules’ election conspiracy theory film issues apology

description: The same solar region that brought an outburst of night-time beauty in early May is coming back around. But things have changed, a space weather expert tells NPR.
title: Are auroras coming back?

description: After an already-slow spring, movie theater attendance over Memorial Day Weekend was the lowest in decades, apart from 2020.
title: Summer box office woes: Hollywood’s optimistic, but movie seats are still empty

description: The Ukrainian border town of Krasnopillia, in the country's northeast, is near the only open checkpoint between Ukraine and Russia. When Ukrainians are freed from Russian captivity, or when the bodies of dead Ukrainian soldiers are returned, they usually come through the town. Our correspondent visited and found the returning countrymen are always welcomed by residents and the staff from the town's scrappy local newspaper.
title: A Visit to the Gateway for Ukrainian Prisoners of War Freed from Russia

description: Shares of Trump Media, the company behind Truth Social, were volatile a day after his historic conviction. It's an early test of how committed his supporters will actually be in owning the shares.
title: Trump supporters have a new rallying cry: Time to 'Buy shares' in Truth Social

description: India's election commission says bribery is one of the biggest challenges to free and fair elections. In tiny Arunachal Pradesh, some voters receive the equivalent of up to a year's average earnings.
title: In a remote Indian state, trading cash and gifts for votes is an open secret

description: Former President Donald Trump reiterated many of claims – without evidence -- that his criminal trial was rigged, a day after a New York jury found him guilty of 34 counts of falsifying business records.
title: Trump repeats claims -- without evidence -- that his trial was rigged

description: Four out of five companies in Europe's largest economy continue to use fax machines. But Germany's parliament has until the end of June to stop relying on the antiquated communication technology.
title: Fax machines permeate Germany's business culture. But parliament is ditching them

description: Thoughtful prompts to help determine whether or not you should be friends with an ex — and what kind of friendship you both want.
title: Should you be friends with your ex? 3 questions to ask yourself

description: A Manhattan jury found former President Donald Trump guilty of all 34 counts of falsifying business records to illegally influence the 2016 election. Trump’s sentencing is scheduled for July 11.
title: Former President Trump found guilty on all 34 felony charges in hush money trial

description: When an NPR reporter heard a startling loud metallic noise in her house, she was about to get an interesting lesson in animal behavior.
title: 'Chimney caps, vent pipes, gutters': Why some woodpeckers are major metal heads

description: Reuniting with birth siblings after an international adoption is a challenging — and emotionally charged — mission. Here are stories from four families.
title: When an adoptee reunites with birth siblings abroad: 'There's no instruction manual'

description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and his Chinese counterpart met for the first time in Singapore on Friday, as Washington and Beijing seek to head off potential conflict in the region.
title: U.S. and Chinese defense chiefs hold first official meeting in Singapore

description: Despite the guilty verdict, Trump remains the Republican nominee for president. Here's how the conviction is already playing out for the campaign.
title: 4 takeaways from the historic felony conviction of Donald Trump

description: Girls in the U.S. are getting their first menstrual period about 6 months earlier on average than they did in the 1950s and ‘60s. And the number of girls starting their period before age nine has doubled. Researchers say parents can help prepare their kids for early puberty.
title: Girls are getting their first periods earlier. Here's what parents should know

description: Nearly two years after Hurricane Ian devastated Southwest Florida, for many, the dream of living in paradise is becoming unaffordable. Making the situation worse, because of lax permitting and development following the hurricane, FEMA is hiking the cost of flood insurance in vulnerable coastal communities like Cape Coral.
title: Hurricane Ian walloped Cape Coral, Fla. Two years later housing costs have spiked

description: Did your brain survive a three-day weekend and the barrage of news this week? If so, maybe you can finally get that 11/11.
title: There's only one Trump question in this week's news quiz. But can you answer it?

description:
A silky shark named Genie traveled from the Galapagos Islands out to the open ocean and back – over 17,000 miles – over the course of a year and a half. That's an average of 31 miles per day, making Genie's journey the longest recorded migration for a silky shark.

Marine scientist Pelayo Salinas de León and his team named Genie in honor of the late marine biologist Eugenie Clark – also known as "The Shark Lady." She devoted her life to the study of sharks and to improving their reputation.

Have another story you want us to cover? Email us at shortwave@npr.org.
title: A silky shark named Genie swam 17,000 miles, a record-breaking migration

description: A Minneapolis police officer was killed when he responded to a shooting call and was providing medical attention to a man who shot him. The suspected gunman and another person were also killed.
title: Police officer, suspect among 3 dead in Minneapolis shooting

description: American and British fighter jets and U.S. ships hit a wide range of Houthi targets in Yemen in response to a recent surge in attacks on ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, U.S. officials said.
title: U.S. and Britain strike Houthi rebel targets in Yemen after surge in shipping attacks

description: Former President Donald Trump is now a convicted felon, but legal experts have told NPR that it's unlikely he will face incarceration.
title: Legal experts say Trump's conviction is unlikely to lead to a prison sentence
